data.title: Nice Find on Urban Wine Trail
data.text: Interesting and diverse selection of Burgundian, Rhone and Bordeaux varietals and blends from a former NASCAR driver that has hired the right people and advisors to produce an authentic and high-quality product line. The tasting room itself is intimate, lounge-like and staffed by knowledgeable and welcoming staff, and it is definitely a not-to-miss participant in the Urban Wine Trail when in Santa Barbara.  Located in the complex that is fronted by The Cask restaurant, and accompanied by a notable lineup of other tasting rooms in the same center for an EZ and convenient way to experience some of the best in Santa Barbara county's diverse AVA's.

data.title: Causally sophificat
data.text: Stopped in on our last day in Santa Barbara! Loved the staff and red blends are a must! Stop in if your are needing a tasting room with some character!!

data.title: My favorite wines.
data.text: My wife, daughter and I visited 5 wineries in the region and the wines of Jamie Sloan were the standout wines for my daughter and I. I loved their Brorific and my daughter loved their Super Tuscan. Unfortunately I was unable to try their Pinot Noir because The French Laundry had just bought their entire stock! I so enjoyed the wines that I joined their club - they don't sell retail and it seems like a good way to get their wines here in Connecticut where I live. Our host for the tastings was very knowledgeable and informative, and she was thrilled to be the one who sold the "300th" club membership...she couldn't have been nicer. What a great find!

data.title: Wine tasting in SB
data.text:
Pretty good. Try the Super Tuscan. You'll love it. Cute little tasting room. Cozy & relaxing. 

Sofie the dog was the best!

data.title: Great visit
data.text: Kim and Jamie are great hosts... knowledgeable and helpful. Great place to visit and spend a little time chatting and tasting.  I truly enjoyed their Red Obsessed tasting.  Great blends and the Cab was my favorite.   My friends also tried some of their whites and really enjoyed them as well.

owner_response.author: Jamie S, Owner at Jamie Slone Wines, responded to this review
owner_response.text: So glad you had a great time.  We are working hard to make sure everyone enjoys their experience.  Cheers!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent wines
data.text: In Santa Barbara celebrating a friend's birthday wine tasting. Super Tuscan, BoRific Bordeaux Blend & Pinot Noir are excellent.

data.title: Wine makers care about their product
data.text: Very tasty wines, a bit upscale. Great location to go taste more wines from other vintners, or do shopping on State St, or any other tourist fun in downtown Santa Barbara.

data.title: Wine tasting
data.text: Great wine tasting session yesterday with Janeanne. And thank you for the restaurant recommendation - we enjoyed it a lot!

data.title: Amazing Private Party Venue!
data.text: I recently planned a trip to Santa Barbara with 22 close friends and family for my wife's 50th birthday.   After researching many places for a special group dinner and party on a Saturday night, I realized that my event was beginning to feel like an expensive wedding reception and not a fun and intimate gathering.  Then I stumbled upon the Jamie Slone Wine Tasting room here on TripAdvisor.   Right in the heart of town, it looked like the perfect size for a 20-24 person private party.  More importantly, their wine had great reviews...critical for the wine snobs among us :)  Better yet, it was right next door to one of the best restaurants in town called The Wine Cask.   Kim Slone was wonderful in providing advice for the event prep, receiving deliveries from a local florist and a bakery, letting me in early to decorate, playing great music and recommending the best food selection and setup with The Wine Cask so we could eat and mingle at the same time (rather than being stuck at a big long table like most of the group settings at restaurants in town).   The party was a huge hit.  Kim and a helper kicked it off with a fantastic wine tasting, with individuals later purchasing bottles of their favorites to share or take home.  Honestly, the wine greatly exceeded our expectations...not cheap stuff, so important that we absolutely loved it!   The whole atmosphere was special...definitely made great memories for the birthday girl and all her friends and family.  Thank you Jamie Slone Wines tor doing things right...you're the best!

owner_response.author: Jamie S, Owner at Jamie Slone Wines, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thrilled you had such a wonderful time.  That's what this is all about....  Giving people an American Riviera Experience!  Look forward to your next visit.

Some new wine offerings on the horizon.  Rosé release April 4th and by end of May we'll have a GSM as well to add to the lineup.  (Rosé, Sav Blanc, Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, Cabernet Sauvignon and 4 different red blends)
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Tasting in no rush... We enjoyed these wines!
data.text:
On Wednesday, October 7, 2015, we decided to drive to Santa Barbara to do some sightseeing and wine tastings. The first wine house we visited was Jamie Slone. Ted, the host, welcomed us and he asked us if we were interested in a wine tasting. We were and therefore he showed us the pre-set options he had. We choose for the 5-wine tasting option with white and red wines. 

His way of presenting the wines was professional, he answered all our questions, and recommended other places to visit. 

We also visited two other wine houses in Santa Barbara, but the wines of Jamie Slone were our absolute favorite!

Thanks for this great experience!

data.title: Premium staff and wine.
data.text: Some of Santa Barbara's best wines and great location. Beautiful relaxing tasting room in best downtown location.

owner_response.author: Jamie S, Owner at Jamie Slone Wines, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks so much for visiting us.  We have several new releases on the tasting flight that represent a variety of different micro climates of Santa Barbara County.  Glad you could enjoy them!

Come see us again...

Cheers
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fantastic Wine
data.text: Jaimie is making really great wines, he and his wife are passionate and are fun loving and lots of love goes into their wine.  I highly recommend them.

owner_response.author: Jamie S, Owner at Jamie Slone Wines, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
It's always great to hear from our fans... especially when they Love our wine.  We work hard represent the quality of Santa Barbara County.  Thank you for the kind words.

Cheers!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Amazing staff. Loved the wine!
data.text: Had great fun with the owners, they stayed open for our visit. Lovely people with amazing wines. I'd definitely return!

owner_response.author: Jamie S, Owner at Jamie Slone Wines, responded to this review
owner_response.text: It was Our pleasure to serve you and we hope to see you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Love just hanging out at this place - historic lounge area
data.text: I ended up signing up as a wine club member.  Great wines!  Jamie, the owner, was pouring the wines and able to give information I never knew about the Santa Barbara Wine country.  I also like this place because my office is downtown, and it's an easy walk for me and a friend to chill after a full day at work.  Two thumbs up for Jamie Slone Wines!

owner_response.author: Jamie S, Owner at Jamie Slone Wines, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We love sharing the differences in the Terroir of Santa Barbara County with our guests.  It's so diverse.. we can make all different kinds of wines.  Come visit again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: LOVE the wine , tasting room, and friendly proprietors!
data.text: Not sure how I found this jewel of a wine tasting room but am so glad we did! The wines are wonderful, and the tasting experience is friendly, relaxed, and informative. We joined the club so we can enjoy back home.

owner_response.author: Jamie S, Owner at Jamie Slone Wines, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We LOVE our Wine Club members... thanks for the pictures!   Cheers
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Make time to visit
data.text: We stumbled on this with accidental luck, and totally enjoyed ourselves. Jamie shared stories with us about how they came to be, and how they are developing their wines. The wines were great, and we learned some new varietals as well. Would absolutely recommend it, and would love to go back!

data.title: Don't miss this little gem!
data.text: What can I say, great wine, warm and inviting atmosphere and Jamie and Kym are fantastic proprietors!  Loved it and will definitely come back again and again.

owner_response.author: Jamie S, Owner at Jamie Slone Wines, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for visiting us and we hope to see you again soon!  Cheers
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Definitely worth a stop
data.text:
We enjoyed our visit to Jaime Sloan.  Each of the wines we tasted was very good (and one excellent).  The owners were both present during part of our visit and had great stories about the wines and the grapes.  The tasting room has a great feel, with both a bar area and some more relaxed seating.

All in all, I would definitely encourage friends to stop in and visit.

owner_response.author: Jamie S, Owner at Jamie Slone Wines, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Almost always either Kym or myself are at the tasting room pouring!  We love hanging out with our guests... Thank you for the nice comments.  Cheers
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great discovery on the Urban Wine Trail
data.text: Jamie and Kym are just as much of a pleasure to chat with as their wines are to taste! This spot was recommended by a friend and we feel lucky to have had the opportunity to taste the first  vintages of Jamie Sloane Wines. Keep your eye out for this winery - a great representation of Santa Barbara style wines!

data.title: Love these guys!
data.text: This was our first stop on our wine-tasting stroll down State Street.  Just a block off the main drag is this cozy, comfortable, attractive tasting room with super personable hosts.  They have loads of good stories about the area and gave great advice about food and drink options.  And of course the wine was good, too.  There were several other tasting rooms within easy walking distance (and they will give you a map to all) but this was our favorite.
